<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

## Description {#details}

A class that represents a single row in the unwind table that is decoded by parsing the DWARF Call Frame Information opcodes.

The row consists of an optional address, the rule to unwind the CFA and all rules to unwind any registers. If the address doesn&#39;t have a value, this row represents the initial instructions for a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dwarf/cie">CIE</a>. If the address has a value the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dwarf/unwindrow">UnwindRow</a> represents a row in the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dwarf/unwindtable">UnwindTable</a> for a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dwarf/fde">FDE</a>. The address is the first address for which the CFA location and register rules are valid within a function.

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dwarf/unwindrow">UnwindRow</a> objects are created by parsing opcodes in the DWARF Call Frame Information and <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dwarf/unwindrow">UnwindRow</a> objects are lazily populated and pushed onto a stack in the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dwarf/unwindtable">UnwindTable</a> when evaluating this state machine. Accessors are needed for the address, CFA value, and register locations as the opcodes encode a state machine that produces a sorted array of <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dwarf/unwindrow">UnwindRow</a> objects 
<SectionUser title="See Also">
<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dwarf/unwindtable">UnwindTable</a>.
</SectionUser>

Definition at line 255 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/debuginfo/include/llvm/debuginfo/dwarf/dwarfdebugframe-h">DWARFDebugFrame.h</a>.

## Public Member Functions

### dump() {#a059c7ec610310aaef931a57658b9ee98}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void UnwindRow::dump (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/raw-ostream">raw&#95;ostream</a> &amp; OS, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/didumpoptions">DIDumpOptions</a> DumpOpts, unsigned IndentLevel=0) const</>}>
Dump the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dwarf/unwindrow">UnwindRow</a> to the stream.

<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="OS">the stream to use for output.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="MRI">register information that helps emit register names insteead of raw register numbers.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="IsEH">true if the DWARF Call Frame Information is from .eh&#95;frame instead of from .debug&#95;frame. This is needed for register number conversion because some register numbers differ between the two sections for certain architectures like x86.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="IndentLevel">specify the indent level as an integer. The <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dwarf/unwindrow">UnwindRow</a> will be output to the stream preceded by 2 &#42; IndentLevel number of spaces.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/debuginfo/include/llvm/debuginfo/dwarf/dwarfdebugframe-h/#l00306">306</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/debuginfo/include/llvm/debuginfo/dwarf/dwarfdebugframe-h">DWARFDebugFrame.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/debuginfo/lib/debuginfo/dwarf/dwarfdebugframe-cpp/#l00171">171</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/debuginfo/lib/debuginfo/dwarf/dwarfdebugframe-cpp">DWARFDebugFrame.cpp</a>.

### Address {#a7ba45488ba90cdb6e4b748e39c4d280a}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>std::optional&lt;uint64&#95;t&gt; llvm::dwarf::UnwindRow::Address</>}>
The address will be valid when parsing the instructions in a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dwarf/fde">FDE</a>.

If invalid, this object represents the initial instructions of a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dwarf/cie">CIE</a>. Address for row in <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dwarf/fde">FDE</a>, invalid for <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dwarf/cie">CIE</a>.
